content.description:
Start up a steep corner, easily climbed on the left side.   Continue up the slab above until below the big overhang.

Clip the bolt on the lip of the overhang and go for it!   Positive thinking will lead to good hidden holds.   A couple more steep moves will see you past the overhang and up to the anchors.
content.protection: 10 bolts, Rappel bolt and chain anchor.
content.location: Climbs the steep corner and large overhang just left of center.

content.description:
Climb up a steep face until possible to move right up a delicate slab up to a roof.

Make a tricky move left around the arete and then commit to the powerful moves through the roof.   Once established in the groove above the roof the climbing eases a little.   At the top of the groove climb the big easy flakes to the anchors.
content.protection: 12 bolts, Rappel bolt and chain anchor.
content.location: Left most route on the crag

content.description:
Climb up the slab until you reach the small roof.  Make the moves over the roof and on up to slab to an obvious flake to the right of an arete.  Make a long reach and move left around the arete onto the slab.

A couple of delicate moves on the slab will give access to the anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts, Rappel bolt and chain anchor
content.location: First bolted line of the crag

content.description: Climb the obvious clean cut left facing corner.
content.protection: Gear to 4".   The lower off anchor is a very small tree (or large sampling).   Two slings and biner in situ.
